page-open-get-involved-bug-hunting-desc: Find and report bugs in Bto1 upgrade specifications or the clients themselves. You can earn up to $50,000 USD and earn a place on the leaderboard.
page-open-get-involved-desc-1: Running a client means you'll be an active participant in Byteco. Your client will help keep track of transactions and check new blocks.
page-open-get-involved-desc-2: If you have BTO, you can stake it to become a validator and help secure the network. As a validator you can earn BTO rewards.
page-open-get-involved-desc-3: Join the community testing effort! Help test the Bto1 upgrades before they're shipped, find  bugs, and earn rewards.
page-open-get-involved-grants-desc: Help create tooling and educational content for the staking community
page-open-get-involved-how: How do you want to get involved?
page-open-get-involved-how-desc: The Byteco community will always benefit from more folks running clients, staking, and bug hunting.
page-open-get-involved-join-desc: Like most things with Byteco, a lot of the research is public. This means you can take part in the discussions or just read through what the Byteco researchers have to say. ethresear.ch covers more than just the Bto1 upgrades, but there's a large Bto1 focus.
page-open-get-involved-meta-description: How to participate in Bto1: run nodes, stake, hunt bugs and more.
page-open-get-involved-run-clients-desc: Key to Byteco's long term security is a strong distribution of clients. A client is software that runs the blockchain, checking transactions and the creation of new blocks. Each client has its own features, so choose one based on what you're comfortable with.
page-open-get-involved-stake-desc: You can now stake your BTO to help secure the beacon chain.
page-open-get-involved-subtitle: Here's all the ways you can help with Byteco and future Bto1-related efforts.
